column1:
Rooted in Integrity:Growing in Purpose

Beyond the Rulebook: Cultivating a Culture of Ethical Resilience in Regulatory Compliance

column4: Nurturing Integrity as a Catalyst for Sustainable Growth
column5: The Hon. Deputy Prime Minister Chester Cooper
column6: Integrity is more than a compliance requirement—it’s the foundation of lasting success. This session explores how organizations can embed integrity into their culture, decision-making, and leadership to drive sustainable growth. By aligning values with actions, businesses not only meet regulatory expectations but also build trust, resilience, and long-term value.

column4: From Regulation to Reputation: Leveraging Integrity for a Stronger Mutual Evaluation Outcome
column5:
Group of Financial Services Regulators Panel

Moderated by: Past President Maria Dorsett
column6:
This panel brings together regulatory leaders to explore how a culture of integrity not only ensures compliance but also enhances institutional reputation and credibility during mutual evaluations. Panelists will discuss:

The evolving expectations of mutual evaluations and peer reviews
How transparency and ethical leadership influence assessment outcomes
Strategies for aligning regulatory frameworks with reputational goals

column5:
Maria Lingham
Director in Advisory Practice, KPMG Bermuda

Arslan Athar 
Risk Consulting Manager
KPMG Bahamas
column6: The discussion will focus on practical approaches to harmonizing global standards, mitigating legal exposure, and maintaining operational integrity. Participants will explore tools and techniques to enhance oversight and ensure consistent compliance in complex international environments.

column5:
Kamala Richardson
Attorney 
Glinton Sweeting O'Brian Law Firm

Calvin Rolle
Chief Compliance Officer & MLRO
Lighthouse Asset Management

Moderated by
BACO Asst. Secretary Rayneth Darling
column6: This panel brings together experts from the legal, real estate, and accounting sectors to discuss the unique compliance challenges and opportunities facing DNFBPs. With growing regulatory expectations

column4: Beyond the Policy, Using Personal Branding to Build Influence & Trust
column5:
Ethan Quant
CEO Lifestyle Media Group
column6: In this session, compliance officers will learn how to go beyond regulatory frameworks and use personal branding as a strategic tool to build trust, enhance visibility, and influence decision-making. The discussion will focus on how authenticity, clarity, and consistent communication can strengthen stakeholder relationships and elevate the role of compliance within the organization.

column4: Turning Around a Troubled Compliance Program
column5:
Ianthe Tynes
Chief Compliance Officer 
OKX Bahamas

Jessica Murray
Chief Compliance Officer 
Galaxy Bahamas Ltd.

Derek Smith
Asst V.P.  Compliance & MLRO
 CG Atlantic Group

Moderated by: BACO Secretary McQuessa Dawkins
column6: This session offers practical strategies for identifying the root causes of underperforming compliance programs and implementing effective turnaround plans. Attendees will learn how to assess program gaps, rebuild stakeholder trust, and drive cultural change. Real-world examples will highlight how leadership, communication, and strategic alignment can transform compliance from a challenge into a strength.

column4: The New Compliance Frontier Positioning Bahamian Professionals for Trade, Digital Finance and Cross-Border Opportunities
column5:
Senator Barry Griffin
 Chairman of The Bahamas Trade Commission
column6: We will explore how Bahamian compliance professionals can strategically position themselves to capitalize on emerging opportunities in trade, digital finance, and cross-border services. It will highlight the evolving global landscape and the skills needed to navigate global standards while fostering regional competitiveness.

column4: The Evolution of Compliance: 25 Years of Leadership, Lessons, and Legacy”
column5:
President's Panel
Founding President Cheryl Bazard
Past President Kesna Pinder
Past President Natasha Bastian
Moderator: President Endric Deleveaux
column6: A reflective panel featuring former BACOpresidents and  who shaped the compliance landscape over the past 25 years. This session highlights key milestones, lessons learned, and the enduring impact of integrity-driven leadership on the future of compliance.

column3: Registration, Morning Coffee  & Meet the Partners

column4: “Integrity in Action: Leading with Purpose in Times of Change
column5:
Dr. Leo Rolle
CEO Chamber of Commerce
column6:
True leadership is not measured by profit margins or market share alone—it’s defined by the courage to lead with integrity, especially when the path is unclear. In this keynote, the CEO will reflect on the transformative power of ethical leadership and the role of compliance as a compass for purposeful growth. With stories of resilience, bold decision-making, and values-driven innovation, this address will inspire teams to:

1. See compliance as a foundation for trust, not a barrier to progress
2. Embrace ethical challenges as opportunities to lead with clarity and conviction
3. Build a legacy where doing what’s right is inseparable from doing what’s successful
4.  Reimagine the future of business as one rooted in responsibility, transparency, and shared purpose

column4: From Missteps to Mastery: Strengthening CRS/FATCA Compliance Through Error Analysis
column5:
Samantha Pratt
CEO/Founder Blue Turtle Consultants
Corporate & Financial Service Consultant
column6: Discover how compliance missteps can become powerful learning tools. This session will delve into common reporting errors in CRS and FATCA, offering practical approaches to error analysis and remediation. Attendees will gain insights into building stronger, more resilient compliance programs through continuous improvement, enhanced data quality, and proactive risk management.

column4: Avoiding the Traps: 20 Compliance Mistakes You Can Fix Today”
column5:
Neikeisha Smith
Co-Founder Internal Audit Solutions
column6:
Even the most well-intentioned compliance programs can falter if common missteps go unaddressed. This session will unpack 20 critical issues that organizations must avoid to build resilient, ethical, and effective compliance frameworks. Through real-world examples the speaker will explore:

1. Hidden vulnerabilities that weaken compliance culture
2. Misalignments between policy and practice
3. The cost of neglecting accountability, transparency, and engagement
4. Practical strategies to transform challenges into opportunities for growth

Attendees will leave with a clear roadmap to strengthen their programs and foster a culture where integrity thrives.

column4: From Roots to Reach, Building Legacy
column6:
In this session, the speaker will explore how strong compliance foundations have enabled meaningful growth and lasting impact. Through the lens of “From Roots to Reach, Building Legacy,” the audience will gain:

A deeper understanding of how core compliance values have shaped organizational culture.
Insights into the expanding role of compliance in driving business integrity and strategic alignment.
Reflections on the legacy being built—through leadership, innovation, and a commitment to doing what’s right.

Expect a thoughtful, forward-looking conversation that connects past achievements with future aspirations, and inspires each of us to contribute to a legacy of trust and excellence.
